intro: Macrocarpaea autanae, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
